[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Function: ScriptFunctionABI::module_name()] [Module existence bypass] Does module_name() validation ensure the referenced module exists on-chain before execution, or can ABIs reference future/non-existent modules, causing runtime errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ArgumentABI] [Ability constraint bypass] Can ArgumentABI::type_tag contain StructTag types without proper ability annotations (copy, drop, store, key), allowing resources to be copied or dropped in violation of Move's resource safety guarantees? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ArgumentABI] [Phantom type exploitation] Can attackers use phantom type parameters in type_tag to circumvent type checking, potentially enabling unauthorized access to generic resources with phantom constraints? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ArgumentABI] [Struct type mismatch] Can type_tag reference StructTag with incorrect type arguments that don't match the struct definition, causing type confusion when the argument is deserialized and used? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: TransactionScriptABI] [Gas calculation bypass] Can extremely large code vectors cause integer overflow in gas calculations (bytecode_size * gas_per_byte), allowing attackers to execute expensive scripts for free? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ScriptFunctionABI] [Type complexity gas undercharge] Can deeply nested type arguments in ty_args cause exponential gas consumption during type instantiation while only charging linear gas, enabling DoS through gas underpricing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ArgumentABI] [Deserialization gas bypass] Can complex TypeTag structures in argument type_tags consume excessive gas during argument deserialization without proper metering, allowing DoS attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: TransactionScriptABI.code] [Bytecode version mismatch] Does the code field enforce bytecode version constraints, or can attackers inject bytecode from incompatible Move versions, causing VM crashes or undefined behavior? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: TransactionScriptABI.code] [Magic number bypass] Can the code vector lack proper Move bytecode magic numbers, allowing execution of arbitrary binary data as if it were valid bytecode, potentially leading to memory corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: TransactionScriptABI.code] [Bytecode verification gap] If code is stored in TransactionScriptABI without immediate verification, can time-of-check-time-of-use (TOCTOU) issues allow unverified bytecode to execute after ABI creation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: TransactionScriptABI.code] [Code size limit bypass] Can attackers create code vectors exceeding Move VM size limits, causing memory exhaustion during deserialization before size validation can occur? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: TransactionScriptABI.code] [Opcode injection] Can malicious bytecode in code contain unsafe or deprecated opcodes that should be rejected by the verifier but aren't checked at ABI level, leading to VM vulnerabilities? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ArgumentABI] [Positional vs named confusion] Can the name field in ArgumentABI be used to bind arguments by name rather than position, and can attackers exploit ambiguity between positional and named binding to cause argument swapping? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: ScriptFunctionABI.args] [Argument count mismatch] Does the args vector length match the actual function signature, or can mismatches cause some arguments to be skipped or duplicated, leading to wrong values being used? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: TransactionScriptABI.args] [Default argument injection] Can missing entries in the args vector be interpreted as default values, and can attackers exploit this to inject unintended default values for sensitive parameters? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ScriptABI] [Cross-validator divergence] If different validators deserialize the same ScriptABI differently due to platform-specific behavior, can this cause consensus failures where validators disagree on transaction validity? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: TransactionScriptABI] [Non-deterministic hash] Can the Hash implementation produce different values on different platforms (e.g., due to endianness), causing validators to compute different transaction hashes and break consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Struct: ScriptFunctionABI] [Module ID canonicalization] Can different canonical representations of the same ModuleId (e.g., with/without leading zeros in address) cause the same function to have different ABI hashes, breaking caching or lookup mechanisms? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: TransactionScriptABI.name] [UTF-8 validation bypass] Can invalid UTF-8 sequences in name strings cause panics during string operations, crashing validators when processing transactions with malformed ABIs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: ScriptFunctionABI.doc] [Normalization attacks] Can Unicode normalization differences (NFC vs NFD) in doc strings cause identical-looking documentation to have different hashes, enabling ABI spoofing attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: ArgumentABI.name] [Case sensitivity confusion] Are argument names case-sensitive, and can attackers exploit case confusion ('Amount' vs 'amount') to bypass validation or cause argument binding errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: TypeArgumentABI.name] [Identifier collision] Can type argument names violate Move identifier constraints (e.g., starting with numbers, containing spaces), causing parsing errors during type substitution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: TransactionScriptABI.ty_args] [Empty type args exploitation] Can an empty ty_args vector be provided for scripts that require type parameters, causing type resolution to fail or use default types that violate safety constraints? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: ScriptFunctionABI.args] [Sparse argument vectors] Can args vectors have gaps or be shorter than expected, causing later arguments to be mapped to wrong positions or skipped entirely? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-core/types/src/abi.rs] [Field: TransactionScriptABI.code] [Vector capacity exploitation] Can attackers allocate code vectors with excessive capacity but small length, wasting memory and potentially causing OOM on validators even if the actual bytecode is small? (Medium)
